ratings.comment: Class is super easy and Sam is really nice. Super forgiving if you ever miss an assignment or anything. 4 online "quizzes" and 1 reflection paper make up your grade but pretty much everyone who completes the reflection gets 100%. Highly recommend this class but it doesn't go very in depth.
Come to class and pass. There was three easy online quizzes. You learn so much things that are valuable. Would definitely recommend!

Sam Veit is the best professor I've had so far. He can answer any question you ask about finance, and he is a very smart man. He is also just one of the nicest guys you will ever meet. I would highly recommend taking a class of his.
He was always prepared for class once a week, and knew how to answer almost every question a student had. I would definitely take another one of Sam's classes.

Doesn't go into depth about finances, but it's an intro 1 credit finance class and what you're taught is useful. If you are looking for something that is a low commitment but beneficial, this is it. Sam is an incredibly kind and understanding person, and that radiates throughout his classes. One of the most inspirational UW faculty I've met.
Very low time commitment, very easy class. Sam is a great guy

Sam is a great professor who knows the material very well and can field any questions you have. The class is definitely introductory in the sense that it doesn't get very deep. He's a funny and sporty guy who relates to the kids. 10/10.

I took this class because I didn't know anything about finance and I have enjoyed having Sam as my professor. This probably isn't a needed course to take if you have in depth knowledge about finance, but it's a really good intro course. It's really easy and Sam makes class bearable. There's barely ever homework and the online quizzes are easy.

I really didn't enjoy this class or instructor at all. The content was very much elementary and did not go into much depth and the instructor was dry. Overall, I did not think that it was a class I needed to take. He didn't teach much that wasn't "learned" from homework outside of class and he spent half of the 50 min lecture talking about himself.

Sam is a caring and funny professor. This class is kind of pointless but he makes going to lectures bearable. He's always cracking jokes and knows a lot about finance in general. easily relates to students

Awesome class, super easy. Almost all of it online, did require research participation but that was super easy. Assignments are simple, quizzes are 10 questions, multiple choice and fill in the blank usually. 2 open book/open note exams online. Interesting class and pretty easy as long as you stay on top of things.

Only 10 minutes for online quizes. Sometimes quizes includes materials from up to 3 chapters, so you're always rushing through the quiz. Worst online class ever because he is too strict about everything.

Sam Veit is an awesome professor. The class is online, but he's extremely organized and quick to respond to any e-mails you send him. Class itself is super applicable to real life and teaches you valuable information about managing finances. Two exams and weekly quizzes/assignments. I'd highly recommend this class to everyone, regardless of major.

Easy A class if taken online. All quizzes and tests are online so you can search through your notes as you take them. It is also a class you will use the knowledge from in real life which is awesome. Highly recommend.
Very easy and useful class. I took the online (lecture 2), and I highly recommend it. Not heavy course-load and all quizes/exams online.
Made a topic interesting.  Relevant assignments.  Do the work and he is a fair grader.  Makes connections to real world.
Best Class EVER. Lecture meets once a week, and is a bit painful to sit through. It is very easy and you learn how to start your own business
